gurmukhi: ਅੰਕ ਰਹੇ ਗਹ ਰਾਮ ਤਿਸੈ ਤਬ || ਰੋੲਿ ਮਿਲੇ ਲਛਨਾਦਿ ਭੱਯਾ ਸਭ ||੨੮੮||
transliteration: Ank Rahe Gad Raam Tisai Tab|| Roe Mile Lachhnaadh Bhayyaa Sabh||288||
translation: At the same time Ram hugged him to his bosom and there Lakshman and all the brother wept.288.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਨ ਪੀਅਾੲਿ ਜਗਾੲਿ ਸੁ ਬੀਰਹ || ਫੇਰਿ ਕਹਯੋ ਹਸ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਰਘੁਬੀਰਹ ||
transliteration: Paan Peeaae Jagade Su Beerah|| Pher(i) Kahyo Has Sriraghoubeerah||
translation: The brave Bharat was brought to his senses by giving water. Ram again said smilingly :

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਿਯੋਦਸ ਬਰਖ ਗੲੇ ਫਿਰਿ ਅੈਹੈ || ਜਾਹੁ ਹਮੈ ਕਛੁ ਕਾਜ ਕਿਵੈਹੈ ||੨੮੯||
transliteration: Triyodas Barakh Gad Phir(i) Aihai|| Jaahu Hamai Kachh(u) Kaaj Kivaihai||289||
translation: “After the elapse of thirteen years we shall return, now you go back because I have to fulfil some tasks in the forest.”289.

gurmukhi: ਚੀਨ ਗੲੇ ਚਤਰਾ ਚਿਤ ਮੋ ਸਭ || ਸ੍ਰੀ ਰਘੁਬੀਰ ਕਹੀ ਅਸ ਕੈ ਜਬ ||
transliteration: Cheen Gad Chatraa Chit Mo Sabh|| Sriraghoubeer Kahias Kai Jab||
translation: When Ram said this, then all the people understood its substance (that he had to kill the demons in the forest).

gurmukhi: ਮਾਤ ਸਮੋਧ ਸੁ ਪਾਵਰਿ ਲੀਨੀ || ਅੳੁਰ ਬਸੇ ਪੁਰ ਅੳੁਧ ਨ ਚੀਨੀ ||੨੯੦||
transliteration: Maat Samodh Su Paavar(i) Leenee|| Aur Bade Pur Audh Na Cheenee||290||
translation: Submitting reverently to the instructions of Ram and with pleased mind Bharat took the sandals of Ram and forgetting the recognition of Ayodhya, he began to live out of its limits.290.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਸ ਜਟਾਨ ਕੋ ਜੂਟ ਧਰੇ ਬਰ || ਰਾਜ ਸਮਾਜ ਦੀਯੋ ਪੳੂਵਾ ਪਰ ||
transliteration: Sees Jataan Ko Jeet Ddare Bar|| Raaj Samaaj Deeyo Paoovaa Par||
translation: Wearing matted hair on his head he dedicated all the royal task to those sandals.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜ ਕਰੇ ਦਿਨੁ ਹੋਤ ੳੁਜਿਅਾਰੈ || ਰੈਨਿ ਭੲੇ ਰਘੁਰਾਜ ਸੰਭਾਰੈ ||੨੯੧||
transliteration: Raaj Dare Din(u) Hot Ujidarai|| Rain(i) Bhae Raghuraaj Sanbhdarai||291||
translation: During the day he used to fulfil his royal duties with the support of those sandals and during the night he protected them.291.

gurmukhi: ਜੱਜਰ ਭਯੋ ਝੁਰ ਝੰਝਰ ਜਿੳੁ ਤਨ || ਰਾਖਤ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਰਘੁਰਾਜ ਬਿਖੈ ਮਨ ||
transliteration: Jajjar Bhayo Jhur Jhanjhar Jio Tan|| Raakhat Sriraghuraaj Bikhai Man||
translation: The body of Bharat withered and become decrepit, but still he always kept the memory of Ram in his mind.

gurmukhi: ਬੈਰਨ ਕੇ ਰਨ ਬਿੰਦ ਨਿਕੰਦਤ || ਭਾਖਤ ਕੰਠਿ ਅਭੂਖਨ ਛੰਦਤ ||੨੯੨||
transliteration: Bairan Ke Ran Bind Nikandat|| Bhaakhat Kanth(i) Abhookhan Chhandat||292||
translation: Alongwith this he destroyed the groups of enemies and instead of ornaments he wore rosaries as necklaces.292.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤੈ ਰਾਮ ਰਾਜੰ || ਕਰੈ ਦੇਵ ਕਾਜੰ || ਧਰੋ ਬਾਨ ਪਾਨੰ || ਭਰੈ ਬੀਰ ਮਾਨੰ ||੨੯੩||
transliteration: Itai Raam Raajan|| Darai Dev Kaajan|| Ddaro Baan Paanan|| Bdarai Beer Maanan||293||
translation: On this side the king ram is doing the duties of gods by killing the demons; he looks like a mighty hero by taking the bow in his hand.293.

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਂ ਸਾਲ ਭਾਰੇ || ਦ੍ਰੁਮੰ ਤਾਲ ਨਯਾਰੇ || ਛੁੲੇ ਸੁਰਗ ਲੋਕੰ || ਹਰੈ ਜਾਤ ਸੋਕੰ ||੨੯੪||
transliteration: Jahaan Saal Bhdare|| Drouman Taal Nydare|| Chhue Surag Lokan|| Darai Jaat Sokan||294||
translation: Where there were the trees of saal in the forest alongwith other trees and tans etc. its glory seemed heaven-like and was destroyer of all sorrows.294.

gurmukhi: ਤਹਾਂ ਰਾਮ ਪੈਠੇ || ਮਹਾਂਬੀਰ ਅੈਠੇ || ਲੀੲੇ ਸੰਗਿ ਸੀਤਾ || ਮਹਾਂ ਸੁਭ੍ਰ ਗੀਤਾ ||੨੯੫||
transliteration: Tahaan Raam Paithe|| Mahaanbeer Aithe|| Leee San(i) Seetaa|| Mahaan Soubhra Geetaa||295||
translation: Ram stayed at that spot and looked like a mighty warrior, Sita was with him who was like a divine song.295.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਧੁੰ ਬਾਕ ਬੈਣੀ || ਮ੍ਰਿਗੀ ਰਾਜ ਨੈਣੀ || ਕਟੰ ਛੀਨ ਦੇ ਸੀ || ਪਰੀ ਪਦਮਨੀ ਸੀ ||੨੯੬||
transliteration: Bidhoung Baak Bainee|| Mrigiraaj Nainee|| Katan Chheen De See|| Paripadmanisee||296||
translation: She was a lady of sweet speech and her eyes were like the queen of deer, she had a slim and she looked like a fairy, a Padmini (amongst women).296.
